reviews.productTitle: Eaton Controls DF10P-C1 Decorator 0-10V Dimmer 120/277V with Color Change Kit, Almond, White, Ivory
reviews.text: The switch is working perfectly, but I had a little snag with installation. I got this for a shop light that came with a dimmer cable. It was easy to wire up and the instructions helped me understand that on-off part of the switch operates on the main power and the dimmer circuit works on the 0-10v part. This wasn't really apparent to me before I read the instructions. This was a single pole install. The main power load (black wire) passes through the switch at the brass "Y" terminal and the black "common" terminal. The brass screw on the "Y" terminal was stripped - it was very difficult to turn in either direction. The nut fell off of it while I tried to fit the wire in place. Because it was stripped, I simply couldn't get the nut back on without disassembling the switch and tapping the screw through it on the workbench. This added more than a half hour overall to the installation process which would have been very quick and easy otherwise. I am sure this was a one-off issue, but three stars due to whatever quality control process allowed this to slip through. Anyway, The price was reasonable compared to other dimmers and extra points to Eaton Controls because the switch had four small screws that allowed access to the internal parts of the device.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021
reviews.title: Install complicated by a stripped screw

reviews.productTitle: Eaton Controls DF10P-C1 Decorator 0-10V Dimmer 120/277V with Color Change Kit, Almond, White, Ivory
reviews.text: Do you realize how hard it is to find an Ivory 0-10v dimming switch lol. Not only that, one that doesn't make the lights flicker. This is the holly grail of dimmer switches as far as I'm concerned. You can even switch the color out for 3 different types. I installed 6 of these recently, all working to perfection. Very solid dimmer switch, for an outrageously good price compared to the competitors. This is why I went with this choice, so hopefully they continue to keep with the competitive price point. It looks great up on the wall, and doesn't look cheaply made at all. Huge thanks coming from me, saved me from spending an arm and a leg finding an Ivory alternative. 10/10 from me.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2021
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.productTitle: Eaton Controls DF10P-C1 Decorator 0-10V Dimmer 120/277V with Color Change Kit, Almond, White, Ivory

I am very upset, I bought a Chinese garbage without knowing it. I do not recommend it.

reviews.title: I missing Original Eaton USA made

reviews.text: I purchased two of the dimmers. One was for use with a Mean Well PWM-120-24 24V 5A 120W PWM output LED power supply and LED strip. The other dimmer was for use with a LED Panel Light. In both cases, the light output of the LED's was much less than without the 10V dimmer wires connected. With a full bright setting, the LED's provided much less than full brightness.

reviews.productTitle: Eaton Controls DF10P-C1 Decorator 0-10V Dimmer 120/277V with Color Change Kit, Almond, White, Ivory
reviews.text: This has two sets of wires. One pair of wires connects to your dimmer pack where it says 0 to 10 V. Separately, this has two or three wires to serve as a regular single pole or three-way switch. (if you use it as a single pole, you don’t use one of the three wires). So to recap, this is a switch plus a dimmer controller in one container. Their best basically separate things. So you will need one set of wires going to the lights with power, and another set for the 0 to 10 V controls. This does not work for systems that do not have 0 to 10 V controls. For example if you buy an LED light fixture that says it is dimmable, and you buy a dimmer that says it’s good for LED lights, that will work with a two wire system. This is not that. If you don’t have a 0 to 10 V dimmer connection on your dimmer pack, don’t buy this.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2021
reviews.title: Wiring details explained:

reviews.productTitle: Eaton Controls DF10P-C1 Decorator 0-10V Dimmer 120/277V with Color Change Kit, Almond, White, Ivory
reviews.text: We weren't sure if we wanted white, almond, or ivory, so Eaton included all three. Nice sales feature. These dimmer units are a little deeper than a conventional switch, so make sure you have enough room for it in your box, and a path to route the violet and purple (0-10 vdc) wires up to your dimmable LED fixtures. Works great.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2020
reviews.title: Good value like all three color faceplates included

reviews.productTitle: Eaton Controls DF10P-C1 Decorator 0-10V Dimmer 120/277V with Color Change Kit, Almond, White, Ivory
reviews.text: 0-10V = commercial tech w/ 120V and 0-10V wiring required (and separation of control/power wires) -- this (and 0-10V dimming fixtures) are probably not appropriate for DIY. We should start to see the 0-10V features replaced by bluetooth or zigbee for DIY applications (I can only hope). I didn't get very good low end (dimmed) on the dimming range from this dimmer. Could be I was viewing my outdoor LED flood light in bright daylight and that affected my perception, but I also didn't like the confusing logic-control interface for setting the dimmer trim to the particular fixture. With the dimming range already close to the limits of perceptibility, setting trim using this model's logic approach I was never satisfied I had achieved the maximum dimming range available from the product (conventional 120V LED dimmers typically include a physical dial trim to adjust the dimmer to a particular fixture; this one uses the master dimmer slide to somehow perform a logic adjustment to match the dimmer -- an extra layer of uncertainty between programmer and end result that makes all the difference (in a bad way).
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020
reviews.title: Didn't get much dimming range. Dimming trim setting was confusing
